metadata.title: CVE-2021-23991 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If a Thunderbird user has previously imported Alice's OpenPGP key, andAlice has extended the validity period of her key, but Alice's updated keyhas not yet been imported, an attacker may send an email containing acrafted version of Alice's key with an invalid subkey, Thunderbird mightsubsequently attempt to use the invalid subkey, and will fail to sendencrypted email to Alice. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.9.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
